availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willis C. Glenn (Caldwell co., ky, commanding serg. (usa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David B. Glenn and Lucinda V. Glenn. Married to Mary C. Davis Glenn in Livingston County, Kentucky, on September 26, 1864. Student in Caldwell County in 1850. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as commanding sergeant from March 11, 1863, to October 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 303A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film #000318176, p. 208.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 402.
"Willis C. Glenn (1837-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial #32069070, accessed May 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32069070.
